comment_text.mn143:2.1: Renowned as the foremost of benefactors, Anāthapiṇḍika appears in over twenty discourses in the Saṁyutta and Aṅguttara Nikāyas, discussing matters such as generosity, guarding the mind, and the development of meditation; the story of his conversion is recorded in the Vinaya (Kd 16:4.1.1). He is well known for his offering of the monastery at which the Buddha most often stayed, but this discourse marks his only personal appearance in the Majjhima.
comment_text.mn143:3.2: The sick Anāthapiṇḍika was consoled by Ānanda at SN 55.27:3.2 and by Sāriputta at SN 55.26:4.2. in other cases, we find the Buddha making such visits to sick monks (SN 22.87:2.7, SN 22.88:2.8, SN 46.14:2.1, SN 46.15:2.1, AN 6.56:2.1), but for some reason visits to householders are only attested for Sāriputta (MN 97:28.2) or Ānanda (SN 47.29:2.2).
comment_text.mn143:5.2: The teaching on the six senses typically begins by establishing awareness on the reality of the eye (etc.) as something that is grasped at (eg. MN 145:3.1). Here Sāriputta skips over this straight to letting go, signfying that his teaching starts with an advanced level of insight.
comment_text.mn143:15.7: The verb here is paṭibhāti, the spontaneous striking of inspiration. Sāriputta is not saying such talks are never given, but that such topics are not what comes to mind when teaching laypeople.

root_text.mn143:1.2: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
root_text.mn143:2.1: Tena kho pana samayena anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati ābādhiko hoti dukkhito bāḷhagilāno.
root_text.mn143:2.2: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati aññataraṁ purisaṁ āmantesi:
root_text.mn143:2.3: “ehi tvaṁ, ambho purisa, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vandāhi:
root_text.mn143:2.6: Yena cāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena āyasmato sāriputtassa pāde sirasā vandāhi:
root_text.mn143:2.8: So āyasmato sāriputtassa pāde sirasā vandatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:2.10: ‘sādhu kira, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto yena anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkamatu anukampaṁ upādāyā’”ti.
root_text.mn143:2.11: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho so puriso anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho so puriso bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.mn143:2.14: Yena cāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho so puriso āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.mn143:2.16: So āyasmato sāriputtassa pāde sirasā vandati;
root_text.mn143:2.18: ‘sādhu kira, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto yena anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkamatu anukampaṁ upādāyā’”ti.
root_text.mn143:3.1: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya āyasmatā ānandena pacchāsamaṇena yena anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi. Nisajja kho āyasmā sāriputto anāthapiṇḍikaṁ gahapatiṁ etadavoca:
root_text.mn143:3.2: “kacci te, gahapati, khamanīyaṁ, kacci yāpanīyaṁ? Kacci te dukkhā vedanā paṭikkamanti, no abhikkamanti; paṭikkamosānaṁ paññāyati, no abhikkamo”ti?
root_text.mn143:4.1: “Na me, bhante sāriputta, khamanīyaṁ na yāpanīyaṁ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṁ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo.
root_text.mn143:4.2: Seyyathāpi, bhante sāriputta, balavā puriso tiṇhena sikharena muddhani abhimattheyya; evameva kho me, bhante sāriputta, adhimattā vātā muddhani ūhananti.
root_text.mn143:4.3: Na me, bhante sāriputta, khamanīyaṁ na yāpanīyaṁ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṁ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo.
root_text.mn143:4.4: Seyyathāpi, bhante sāriputta, balavā puriso daḷhena varattakhaṇḍena sīse sīsaveṭhaṁ dadeyya; evameva kho me, bhante sāriputta, adhimattā sīse sīsavedanā.
root_text.mn143:4.5: Na me, bhante sāriputta, khamanīyaṁ na yāpanīyaṁ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṁ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo.
root_text.mn143:4.6: Seyyathāpi, bhante sāriputta, dakkho goghātako vā goghātakantevāsī vā tiṇhena govikantanena kucchiṁ parikanteyya; evameva kho me, bhante sāriputta, adhimattā vātā kucchiṁ parikantanti.
root_text.mn143:4.7: Na me, bhante sāriputta, khamanīyaṁ na yāpanīyaṁ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṁ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo.
root_text.mn143:4.8: Seyyathāpi, bhante sāriputta, dve balavanto purisā dubbalataraṁ purisaṁ nānābāhāsu gahetvā aṅgārakāsuyā santāpeyyuṁ, samparitāpeyyuṁ; evameva kho me, bhante sāriputta, adhimatto kāyasmiṁ ḍāho.
root_text.mn143:4.9: Na me, bhante sāriputta, khamanīyaṁ na yāpanīyaṁ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṁ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo”ti.
root_text.mn143:5.2: ‘na cakkhuṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me cakkhunissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:5.5: ‘na sotaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me sotanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:5.8: ‘na ghānaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me ghānanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:5.11: ‘na jivhaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me jivhānissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:5.14: ‘na kāyaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me kāyanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:5.17: ‘na manaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me manonissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:6.2: ‘na rūpaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me rūpanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:6.9: na dhammaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me dhammanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:7.2: ‘na cakkhuviññāṇaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me cakkhuviññāṇanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:7.9: na manoviññāṇaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me manoviññāṇanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:8.2: ‘na cakkhusamphassaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me cakkhusamphassanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:8.9: na manosamphassaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me manosamphassanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:9.2: ‘na cakkhusamphassajaṁ vedanaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me cakkhusamphassajāvedanānissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:9.9: na manosamphassajaṁ vedanaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me manosamphassajāvedanānissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:10.2: ‘na pathavīdhātuṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me pathavīdhātunissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:10.9: na viññāṇadhātuṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me viññāṇadhātunissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:11.2: ‘na rūpaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me rūpanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:11.8: na viññāṇaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me viññāṇanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:12.2: ‘na ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me ākāsānañcāyatananissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:12.7: na nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me nevasaññānāsaññāyatananissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:13.2: ‘na idhalokaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me idhalokanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:14.2: ‘na paralokaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me paralokanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:14.5: ‘yampi me diṭṭhaṁ sutaṁ mutaṁ viññātaṁ pattaṁ pariyesitaṁ anupariyesitaṁ anucaritaṁ manasā tampi na upādiyissāmi, na ca me tannissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
root_text.mn143:15.1: Evaṁ vutte, anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati parodi, assūni pavattesi.
root_text.mn143:15.2: Atha kho āyasmā ānando anāthapiṇḍikaṁ gahapatiṁ etadavoca:
root_text.mn143:15.3: “olīyasi kho tvaṁ, gahapati, saṁsīdasi kho tvaṁ, gahapatī”ti?
root_text.mn143:15.5: api ca me dīgharattaṁ satthā payirupāsito manobhāvanīyā ca bhikkhū;
root_text.mn143:15.6: na ca me evarūpī dhammī kathā sutapubbā”ti.
root_text.mn143:15.7: “Na kho, gahapati, gihīnaṁ odātavasanānaṁ evarūpī dhammī kathā paṭibhāti;
root_text.mn143:15.8: pabbajitānaṁ kho, gahapati, evarūpī dhammī kathā paṭibhātī”ti.
root_text.mn143:15.9: “Tena hi, bhante sāriputta, gihīnampi odātavasanānaṁ evarūpī dhammī kathā paṭibhātu.
root_text.mn143:15.10: Santi hi, bhante, kulaputtā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti;
root_text.mn143:16.1: Atha kho āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca ānando anāthapiṇḍikaṁ gahapatiṁ iminā ovādena ovaditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamiṁsu.
root_text.mn143:16.2: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati, acirapakkante āyasmante ca sāriputte āyasmante ca ānande, kālamakāsi tusitaṁ kāyaṁ upapajji.
root_text.mn143:17.1: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko devaputto abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇo kevalakappaṁ jetavanaṁ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi.
root_text.mn143:17.2: Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho anāthapiṇḍiko devaputto bhagavantaṁ gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi:
root_text.mn143:18.4: “samanuñño me satthā”ti bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tatthevantaradhāyi.
root_text.mn143:19.1: Atha kho bhagavā tassā rattiyā accayena bhikkhū āmantesi:
root_text.mn143:19.2: “imaṁ, bhikkhave, rattiṁ aññataro devaputto abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇo kevalakappaṁ jetavanaṁ obhāsetvā yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi.
root_text.mn143:19.3: Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho so devaputto maṁ gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi:
root_text.mn143:19.21: ‘Samanuñño me satthā’ti maṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tatthevantaradhāyī”ti.
root_text.mn143:20.1: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.mn143:20.2: “so hi nūna so, bhante, anāthapiṇḍiko devaputto bhavissati.
root_text.mn143:20.3: Anāthapiṇḍiko, bhante, gahapati āyasmante sāriputte abhippasanno ahosī”ti.
root_text.mn143:20.5: Yāvatakaṁ kho, ānanda, takkāya pattabbaṁ, anuppattaṁ taṁ tayā.
root_text.mn143:20.8: Attamano āyasmā ānando bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandīti.

translation_text.mn143:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
translation_text.mn143:2.1: Now at that time the householder Anāthapiṇḍika was sick, suffering, gravely ill.
translation_text.mn143:2.3: “Please, worthy man, go to the Buddha, and in my name bow with your head to his feet. Say to him:
translation_text.mn143:2.4: ‘Sir, the householder Anāthapiṇḍika is sick, suffering, gravely ill.
translation_text.mn143:2.5: He bows with his head to your feet.’
translation_text.mn143:2.6: Then go to Venerable Sāriputta, and in my name bow with your head to his feet. Say to him:
translation_text.mn143:2.7: ‘Sir, the householder Anāthapiṇḍika is sick, suffering, gravely ill.
translation_text.mn143:2.8: He bows with his head to your feet.’
translation_text.mn143:2.10: ‘Sir, please visit him at his home out of sympathy.’”
translation_text.mn143:2.11: “Yes, sir,” that man replied. He did as Anāthapiṇḍika asked.
translation_text.mn143:3.1: Then Venerable Sāriputta robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went with Venerable Ānanda as his second monk to Anāthapiṇḍika’s home. He sat down on the seat spread out, and said to Anāthapiṇḍika,
translation_text.mn143:3.2: “I hope you’re keeping well, householder; I hope you’re all right. And I hope the pain is fading, not growing, that its fading is evident, not its growing.”
translation_text.mn143:4.1: “I’m not keeping well, Honorable Sāriputta, I’m not getting by. The pain is terrible and growing, not fading, its growing, not its fading, is evident.
translation_text.mn143:4.2: The winds piercing my head are so severe, it feels like a strong man drilling into my head with a sharp point.
translation_text.mn143:4.4: The pain in my head is so severe, it feels like a strong man tightening a strong leather strap around my head.
translation_text.mn143:4.6: The winds slicing my belly are so severe, like a deft butcher or their apprentice were slicing open a cows’s belly with a sharp meat cleaver.
translation_text.mn143:4.8: The burning in my body is so severe, it feels like two strong men grabbing a weaker man by the arms to burn and scorch him on a pit of glowing coals. That’s how severe the burning is in my body.
translation_text.mn143:4.9: I’m not keeping well, Honorable Sāriputta, I’m not getting by. The pain is terrible and growing, not fading, its growing, not its fading, is evident.”
translation_text.mn143:5.1: “That’s why, householder, you should train like this:
translation_text.mn143:5.2: ‘I shall not grasp the eye, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on the eye.’
translation_text.mn143:5.5: ‘I shall not grasp the ear, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on the ear.’ …
translation_text.mn143:5.8: ‘I shall not grasp the nose, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on the nose.’ …
translation_text.mn143:5.11: ‘I shall not grasp the tongue, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on the tongue.’ …
translation_text.mn143:5.14: ‘I shall not grasp the body, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on the body.’ …
translation_text.mn143:5.17: ‘I shall not grasp the mind, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on the mind.’
translation_text.mn143:6.2: ‘I shall not grasp sight, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on sight.’ …
translation_text.mn143:6.9: idea, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on idea.’
translation_text.mn143:7.2: ‘I shall not grasp eye consciousness, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on eye consciousness.’ …
translation_text.mn143:7.9: mind consciousness, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on mind consciousness.’
translation_text.mn143:8.9: mind contact, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on mind contact.’
translation_text.mn143:9.2: ‘I shall not grasp feeling born of eye contact …
translation_text.mn143:9.9: feeling born of mind contact, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on the feeling born of mind contact.’
translation_text.mn143:10.2: ‘I shall not grasp the earth element …
translation_text.mn143:10.9: consciousness element, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on the consciousness element.’
translation_text.mn143:11.8: consciousness, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on consciousness.’
translation_text.mn143:12.2: ‘I shall not grasp the dimension of infinite space …
translation_text.mn143:12.7: the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.’
translation_text.mn143:13.2: ‘I shall not grasp this world, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on this world.’
translation_text.mn143:14.2: ‘I shall not grasp the other world, and there shall be no consciousness of mine dependent on the other world.’
translation_text.mn143:14.5: ‘I shall not grasp whatever is seen, heard, thought, known, attained, sought, and explored by my mind, and my consciousness will not have that as support.’
translation_text.mn143:15.1: When he said this, Anāthapiṇḍika cried and burst out in tears.
translation_text.mn143:15.3: “Are you failing, householder? Are you fading, householder?”
translation_text.mn143:15.5: But for a long time I have paid homage to the Buddha and the esteemed mendicants.
translation_text.mn143:15.6: Yet I have never before heard such a Dhamma talk.”
translation_text.mn143:15.7: “Householder, such Dhamma talk does not strike when teaching white-clothed laypeople.
translation_text.mn143:15.8: Rather, it strikes when teaching those gone forth.”
translation_text.mn143:15.9: “Well then, Honorable Sāriputta, let such Dhamma talk strike when teaching white-clothed laypeople as well!
translation_text.mn143:15.10: There are gentlemen with little dust in their eyes. They’re in decline because they haven’t heard the teaching.
translation_text.mn143:15.11: There will be those who understand the teaching!”
translation_text.mn143:16.1: And when the venerables Sāriputta and Ānanda had given the householder Anāthapiṇḍika this advice they got up from their seat and left.
translation_text.mn143:16.2: Not long after they had left, Anāthapiṇḍika passed away and was reborn in the host of joyful gods.
translation_text.mn143:17.1: Then, late at night, the glorious godling Anāthapiṇḍika, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side,
translation_text.mn143:17.2: and addressed the Buddha in verse:
translation_text.mn143:17.4: frequented by the Saṅgha of seers,
translation_text.mn143:17.5: where the King of Dhamma stayed:
translation_text.mn143:17.14: and thus be purified in it.
translation_text.mn143:17.17: Even a mendicant who has crossed over
translation_text.mn143:18.1: This is what the godling Anāthapiṇḍika said,
translation_text.mn143:18.4: knowing that the teacher approved, bowed and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.
translation_text.mn143:19.1: Then, when the night had passed, the Buddha told the mendicants all that had happened.
translation_text.mn143:20.1: When he had spoken, Venerable Ānanda said to the Buddha:
translation_text.mn143:20.2: “Sir, that godling must surely have been Anāthapiṇḍika.
translation_text.mn143:20.3: For the householder Anāthapiṇḍika was devoted to Venerable Sāriputta.”
translation_text.mn143:20.5: You’ve reached the logical conclusion, as far as logic goes.
translation_text.mn143:20.6: For that was indeed the godling Anāthapiṇḍika.”
translation_text.mn143:20.7: That is what the Buddha said.
translation_text.mn143:20.8: Satisfied, Venerable Ānanda approved what the Buddha said.

variant_text.mn143:2.3: pāde sirasā vandāhi → vandāhi evañca vadehi (sya-all, km, pts1ed) | bhagavato pāde sirasā vandāhi → vandāhi evañca vadehi (sya-all, km, pts1ed)
variant_text.mn143:4.2: muddhani → muddhānaṁ (sya-all, km, pts1ed) | abhimattheyya → abhimantheyya (bj) | ūhananti → ohananti (sya-all, km)
variant_text.mn143:4.4: sāriputta, adhimattā sīse sīsavedanā → adhimattā vātā sīsaṁ parikantanti (bj, sya-all, km)

reference_text.mn143:8.1: csp1ed11.304, csp2ed11.304, ms11M_1110, nya8, pts-vp-pli3.260, vri14.312
